page.title: 12Animals in the Hutton Area
page.content: As this is an area with many unculti- vated parts and mixed woodland,it is a good habitat for a great variety of animals,birds and flowers.Badgers have setts in the woods.Roe deer are in Douthwaitedale.Grey squirrels are common in all the woods.There is an abundance of rabbits,a few hares and some foxes.Hedgehogs are common every -where and often come into the gardens On summer evenings long-eared bats can frequently be seen flying about.Moles have runs in many of the fields and there are weasels, stoats,voles and field mice.Water voles can sometimes be seen in or near the rivers.Adders and grass snakes are found on the moor Frogs and toads are still found in various damp places,but their numbers have decreased in recent years.
